definition: to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer

sentences.english: What we Chinese do best, is to endure.
sentences.chinese: 中國人是最能忍辱負重的人民。

sentences.english: Get plank brick this matter, if stem good, call to meekly tolerate insult negative heavy.
sentences.chinese: 挨板磚這事，如果幹得好，叫忍辱負重。

sentences.english: Why do we have to live like this when we don't want to?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼人一定要忍辱負重地活着？

sentences.english: Our future life is an important power, is called a humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 我們未來生活的一種重要能力，叫做忍辱負重的能力。

sentences.english: For people, to endure humiliation is another moral integrity.
sentences.chinese: 爲了人民的事業，忍辱負重，也是另一種骨氣。

sentences.english: Under those circumstances, I had to put my pride in my pocket.
sentences.chinese: 在那種情況下，我必須忍辱負重。

definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
competitive/ambitious and aggressive/to desire to beat others
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
affectionate/an affectionate person
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
no complaints/to have no regrets
chivalrous/chivalry/knight-errantry
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to give one's heart to/to devote one's life to
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
